SENT.plain: We describe the clinical manifestations, radiological features and response to therapy of a 10-year-old child with idiopathic hypertrophic cranial pachymeningitis, a rare condition with potentially severe disabling neurological consequences
The child presented with progressive cranial polyneuropathies secondary to dural compression of the neural and vascular structures within the cavernous sinus
Corticosteroids and methotrexate proved effective in inducing near complete and sustained remission of the condition
To our knowledge, this is the first case reported of idiopathic hypertrophy cranial pachymeningitis in a child
The experience with oral methotrexate to treat this entity in a child has also never been reported
Idiopathic cranial hypertrophic pachymeningitis should be considered in children presenting with a progressive cranial polyneuropathies
